videoData.title: Who should pay for a first date?
videoData.socialTitle: Who should pay for a first date?

nodes.whoTheyAre: Jared Freid is a stand-up comedian based out of New York City, with a strong focus on dating and relationships. His comedy is current and reflects the ordinary daily thoughts of everyone you know, especially if you know a lot of millennials that are obsessing over dating apps, trying to be real adults, and worrying about their bodies. (For the record, Jared’s mom thinks his body is “just fine.”) Jared has a remarkable insight into how millennial relationships (or even situationships) begin and end. Many of Jared's fans say that his advice has helped them in their personal lives. Jared’s fans also seek out his voice in the online publishing world. He’s written for TotalFratMove, BroBible, Betches, and HeTexted. His columns delve into everything from sports to The Bachelor to the pitfalls of dating in the information age. His writing has both sides of the aisle nodding their head while thinking, “I’ve been on the toilet way too long.”

videoData.description: In a dating landscape plagued with anxiety about double-texts and who grabs the check, "it's way easier to have rules than to have feelings," says stand-up comedian and podcast host Jared Freid. In this funny talk, he shares how owning your feelings can help you avoid a minefield of trick questions and shifting social norms.
videoData.socialDescription: In a dating landscape plagued with anxiety about double-texts and who grabs the check, "it's way easier to have rules than to have feelings," says stand-up comedian and podcast host Jared Freid.
